text: Mr. Wilde said that twilight is getting out of fashion. It is doubtful that this defect could be concealed if the landscapes were constantly changing in location. Seeing a landscape in one place is necessarily boring. Otherwise, it would be lovely. And it was spectacular. A bunch of trees migrating under the sky. Or a tree that would pass through the jungle alone, straight, on its countless white ducks. But then people would invent cages to hunt landscapes. And a landscape inside a cage must not feel happy
title: Paisajes ambulantes
author: Luis Vidales
